intro: Chamaesyce deppeana, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Chamaesyce deppeana is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
